20110107221834.000|20110107221836.000|TR0|But let's go to CNN Martin Savidge right 
20110107221836.000|20110107221838.000|TR0|now, he's in Mississippi.       MARTIN 
20110107221838.000|20110107221840.000|TR0|SAVIDGE, CNN CORRESPONDENT:  Wolf, it was 
20110107221840.000|20110107221842.000|TR0|a remarkable news conference.  In fact, as 
20110107221842.000|20110107221844.000|TR0|the two sisters came in, there was 
20110107221844.000|20110107221846.000|TR0|tremendous cheering in the crowd in which 
20110107221846.000|20110107221848.000|TR0|you heard, "free at last, free at last, 
20110107221848.000|20110107221850.000|TR0|thank god all mighty, free at last," of 
20110107221850.000|20110107221852.000|TR0|course, hearkening back to the days of the 
20110107221852.000|20110107221855.000|TR0|Civil Rights Movement.
20110107221855.000|20110107221857.000|TR0|
20110107221857.000|20110107221859.000|TR0|But the news conference itself was full of 
20110107221859.000|20110107221901.000|TR0|cheers and tears and laughter and 
20110107221901.000|20110107221903.000|TR0|celebration and determination.  When the 
20110107221903.000|20110107221905.000|TR0|two sisters actually got up to speak, you 
20110107221905.000|20110107221907.000|TR0|could hear a pin drop and you could tell 
20110107221907.000|20110107221909.000|TR0|there was so much emotion wrapped up 
20110107221909.000|20110107221911.000|TR0|inside of them.  They were speaking in 
20110107221911.000|20110107221913.000|TR0|halting voices, tears in their eyes and 
20110107221913.000|20110107221916.000|TR0|occasionally hanging on to one another.
20110107221916.000|20110107221918.000|TR0|
20110107221918.000|20110107221920.000|TR0|And at one point, I asked the sisters, 
20110107221920.000|20110107221922.000|TR0|when exactly and how were they informed of
